subject: Sales
title: The Travelling Salesman
description: A fast breakdown of The Travelling Salesman for builders.

hook.text: With a suitcase and a train ticket, travelling salesmen brought the world to doorsteps across America.

buildup.text: They were the original field reps: covering territories, building rapport, and closing face to face.

discovery.text: Companies like Fuller Brush and Avon built empires entirely on door-to-door selling and live demos.

twist.text: Travelling salesmen also earned a shady reputation. Aggressive tactics and snake oil eroded public trust.

climax.text: The model faded but its core lesson persists: nothing beats a personal connection and live demonstration.

punchline.text: Door-to-door selling proved that personal touch closes.

quiz.question: What was the lasting lesson of door-to-door selling?
options: Personal connection and live demos are powerful closers
